Package org.apache.juneau.assertions

Class FluentStringListAssertion<R>

java.lang.Object
org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion
org.apache.juneau.assertions.FluentAssertion<R>
org.apache.juneau.assertions.FluentObjectAssertion<java.util.Collection<E>,​R>
org.apache.juneau.assertions.FluentCollectionAssertion<E,​R>
org.apache.juneau.assertions.FluentListAssertion<java.lang.String,​R>
org.apache.juneau.assertions.FluentStringListAssertion<R>
Type Parameters:
R - The return type.
Direct Known Subclasses:
StringListAssertion
public class FluentStringListAssertion<R>
extends FluentListAssertion<java.lang.String,​R>
Used for fluent assertion calls against lists of strings.

  • Constructor Details

    • FluentStringListAssertion

      public FluentStringListAssertion​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> value, R returns)
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      value - The object being tested.
      Can be null.
      returns - The object to return after a test method is called.
      If null, the test method returns this object allowing multiple test method calls to be used on the same assertion.

    • FluentStringListAssertion

      public FluentStringListAssertion​(Assertion creator, java.util.List<java.lang.String> value, R returns)
      Chained constructor.

      Used when transforming one assertion into another so that the assertion config can be used by the new assertion.

      Parameters:
      creator - The assertion that created this assertion.
      Should be null if this is the top-level assertion.
      value - The object being tested.
      Can be null.
      returns - The object to return after a test method is called.
      If null, the test method returns this object allowing multiple test method calls to be used on the same assertion.

    • asJoin

      public FluentStringAssertion<R> asJoin​(java.lang.String delimiter, java.lang.String prefix, java.lang.String suffix)
      Concatenates this list of strings into a FluentStringAssertion.
      Parameters:
      delimiter - The delimiter to be used between each element.
      prefix - The sequence of characters to be used at the beginning of the joined result.
      suffix - The sequence of characters to be used at the end of the joined result.
      Returns:
      A new assertion.

    • asTrimmed

      public FluentStringListAssertion<R> asTrimmed()
      Trims all strings in this list (ignoring null) and returns it as a new string-list assertion.
      Returns:
      A new assertion.

    • setMsg

      public FluentStringListAssertion<R> setMsg​(java.lang.String msg, java.lang.Object... args)
      Description copied from class: Assertion
      Allows you to override the assertion failure message.

      String can contain "{msg}" to represent the original message.

      Example:

      import static org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*; // Throws an assertion with a custom message instead of the default "Value was null." assertString(myString) .setMsg("My string was bad: {msg}") .isNotNull();

      Overrides:
      setMsg in class FluentListAssertion<java.lang.String,​R>
      Parameters:
      msg - The assertion failure message.
      args - Optional message arguments.
      Returns:
      This object.

    • setOut

      public FluentStringListAssertion<R> setOut​(java.io.PrintStream value)
      Description copied from class: Assertion
      If an error occurs, send the error message to the specified stream instead of STDERR.
      Overrides:
      setOut in class FluentListAssertion<java.lang.String,​R>
      Parameters:
      value - The output stream. Can be null to suppress output.
      Returns:
      This object.

    • setSilent

      public FluentStringListAssertion<R> setSilent()
      Description copied from class: Assertion
      Suppresses output to STDERR.

      This is the equivalent to calling out(null).

      Overrides:
      setSilent in class FluentListAssertion<java.lang.String,​R>
      Returns:
      This object.

    • setStdOut

      Overrides:

    • setThrowable

      public FluentStringListAssertion<R> setThrowable​(java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.RuntimeException> value)
      Description copied from class: Assertion
      If an error occurs, throw this exception instead of the standard AssertionError.

      The throwable class must have a public constructor that takes in any of the following parameters:

      • Throwable - The caused-by exception (if there is one).
      • String - The assertion failure message.

      If the throwable cannot be instantiated, a RuntimeException is thrown instead.

      Example:

      import static org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*; // Throws a BadRequest instead of an AssertionError if the string is null. assertString(myString) .setThrowable(BadRequest.class) .isNotNull();

      Overrides:
      setThrowable in class FluentListAssertion<java.lang.String,​R>
      Parameters:
      value - The new value for this setting.
      Returns:
      This object.
